Table of Contents

Name


user_env -- Cplant user_environment startup script

Synopsis


user_env start|stop|restart bebopd|pct|yod

Description

user_env is the script in the init.d/ directory which is used to start or stop cplant daemon processes on a node. If yod is given, the script sets up some links appropriate for yod submission, and exits. If pct is given, a pct process is started. If bebopd is given, it starts up bebopd. If bebopd is given, the script looks for a line in etc/cfg with bebopd_arguments appearing before a colon, what appears after the colon is a verbatim list of arguments to give to bebopd. If such a line does not exist, user_env simply runs bebopd -d. In this way the bebopd arguments are saved in the cfg file rather than this script (although it is a bit of a hack!).

See Also


cfg, cplant, Guide to building and installing Cplant
